full_text: pt eta Cl S as s : eo Elna 2020/KER/1197 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE P.B.SURESH KUMAR FRIDAY, THE 10TH DAY OF JANUARY 2020 / 20TH POUSHA, 1941 Crl.MC.No.147 OF 2020 (G) CRIME NO.259/2019 OF Kolathur Police Station , Malappuram PETITIONER/ACCUSED : SHIHABUDHEEN P, AGED 37 YEARS S/O HAMZA, POOVIL HOUSE, KOLATHUR , KOLATHUR P.O.MALAPPURAM-679 338. BY ADV. SRI.MANSOOR.B.H. RESPONDENTS/STATE & DEFACTO COMPLAINANT: 1 STATE OF KERALA REP. BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM-682 031. 2 STATION HOUSE OFFICER KOLATHUR POLICE STATION, MALAPPURAM DIST 679 338 3 RISWANAN K.M., AGED 23 YEARS W/O ABDUL RAHIM, POOVIL HOUSE, KOLATHUR KOLATHUR P.O.MALAPPURAM-679 338. R3 BY ADV. JANET JOB BY SRI. AMJED ALI THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 10.01.2020, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: 2020/KER/1197 Crl.M.C. No.147 of 2020 2 Cril.M.C.No.147 of 2020 ORDER This is a proceedings under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for quashing Annexure - A First Information Report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto in Crime No.259 of 2019 of Kolathur Police Station. 2. The petitioner is the sole accused in the said case. The case was one registered under Sections 323 and 354 of the Indian Penal Code. 3. It is stated that the petitioner and the de facto complainant have amicably settled the disputes and an affidavit sworn to by the de facto complainant to that effect has been produced as Annexure B. 4. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioner, the learned Public Prosecutor as also the learned counsel for the de facto complainant. 5. In the light of the decision of the Apex Court in Gian singh v. State of Punjab, (2012) 10 SCC 303, insofar as 2020/KER/1197 Crl.M.C. No.147 of 2020 3 the offences alleged against the petitioner in the case are only offences punishable under Sections 323 and 354 of the Indian Penal Code, | am of the view that this is an appropriate case where this court has to invoke the jurisdiction under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure to quash the proceedings against the petitioner. In the result, the Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure - A First Information Report and all further proceedings pursuant thereto in Crime No.259 of 2019 of Kolathur Police Station are quashed. Sd/- P.B.SURESH KUMAR, JUDGE. ds ips eee Cl x, pes a eo Plies 2020/KER/1197 Cril.M.C.
